dict.acceptation: 有（ have的过去式和过去分词 ）；（亲属关系中）接受；拿；买到；

sent.orig: He waited until everyone had had a say and he had had the opportunity of thinking things over before he put forward a different view from the rest.
sent.trans: 他等到大家发言差不多了，自己反复思考，再提出与众不同的见解。

sent.orig: Both men had hardly had time to realize what had happened when they were thrown violenly into the sea.
sent.trans: 那个人未来得及弄明白所发生的事，突然都被猛烈地抛进了大海。

sent.orig: A mosquito had bitten her and her arm had swollen up.
sent.trans: 蚊子叮了她，她的手臂肿起来了。

sent.orig: After their quarrel, Jim and Mary found that their relationship had gone off the boil, and they were never again as loving as they had been.
sent.trans: 吵架过后，吉姆和玛丽发现，他们之间的关系已经冷了下来，再也不会像以前那么相亲相爱了。

sent.orig: Ah Q had always had the greatest contempt for such people as little nuns.
sent.trans: 小尼姑之流是阿Q本来视如草芥的。
